title: "Tristana, not really known for her hyperscaling...," -Phreak
body: What happened? Pre rework trist was KNOWN for her hypercarrying. Now, a few nerfs and a rework later she has lost this as a core  identity. Riot says that the goal of reworking is to modernize the kit but keep certain core identities that a champion possesses. Would love some discussion about this.

replies.body: Right now, her problem is there is little reason to pick her over Jinx besides her mobility, besides that, Jinx gets better AoE damage, more range, a better AS increase that doesn't even have a CD at that, and a better ulti damage wise. Before had, she had a niche of getting to outscale and outrange every ADC to make up for her downfalls, with that gone and a stupidly lose base AS, she isn't worth it anymore.

Exactly. I used to juggle between {{champion:18}} {{champion:222}} as my go-to ADC's, now I pick ONLY Jinx. Tristana no longer is the late game god she used to be, and her early game is just as bad as it was before the rework. Nerfing her passive crossed the line.

The only thing she has over jinx is she takes turrets faster.

If they are both far away, yeah, Tristana is faster, if close up, no, still Jinx, Jinx's AS increase is better at all stages and the problem there is Jinx's AS increase is linked to the skill you level first on her while Tristana, you level her AS increase second.

Tristana's E allows her to take turrets signifigantly faster than jinx, clocking in at around 3 seconds mid-game if you have Berserker greaves, IE, Shiv, and LW. That is even faster if you have a PD instead of shiv, or a BT instead of LW.

Tristana trades her safety for ANY kind of useability .  You can stay at distance and run if anyone closes (but do no damage due to your shorter range) or you can close and hit, but put yourself in serious danger (if you don't kill, your W is useless if you've jumped in, and even if you have it, half the champs in the game can interrupt it somehow).  And as useful as the knockback from the ult is (assuming you don't screw up half your team attacks while trying to escape) the range is the same as your aa, so much shorter than Jinx and still in range of a bunch of hurt, not to mention its useless when champs go untargetable (Fizz, Akali, Talon, etc).

this is exactly how I feel with veigar. :( had a 55(ish)% win rate with him, but ever since his "compensation" I can't even tolerate to play him.

Riot really loves to screw over champs with their reworks. I feel like sion is the only real rework that actually turned out well.
Viktor's rework worked out pretty well. He's see more play in mid lane and he scales better late game compared to his old self.

That SKT Vs EDG game Tristana just didn't have a way to stop Kalista......

Until level 10 Kalista can aa q aa then leap out of range and all trist can do is aa once.
That match exemplified how weak {{champion:18}} currently is. If you ask me, the Tristana pick cost EDG the game.
Or showed how overpowered Kalista is... It's all relative in terms of your viewpoint.
Kalista doesn't wreck face against other AD carries nearly as hard as she did against that Trist. There's a bit of a Trist problem going on.

Kalista was played MAD well in that match. I don't think that Tristana was a good pick but that doesn't mean that she is not useful at some points. It was a composition win, not a pick win.

I don't say that Tristana is par with other carries, I just wanted to point out that she was not the cause of the loss.

She's been crippled after the rework. Her passive feels almost meaningless, she is COMPLETELY reliant on Rapid Fire due to the attack speed nerfs, Rocket Jump is nice but feels clunky with the delay, and Explosive Shot's large cast time just make her feel AWFUL to play as. My suggestions: Remove cast time on her E, Raise her attack speed scaling, reduce Rapid fire's cooldown, but lower the attack speed boost significantly, and revert the nerf to her passive.
What happened is that Riot ruined Tris with the rework.
The issue isn't even the mechanics of the rework, they did fine there, it's that they gutted her numbers across the board for it, passive, as, health, and armor, all got nerfed.

Yeah, you're right.

Tris has always had spells on **long **cooldowns that do basically what her spells now do (RIP heal debuff), but now she has worse range, worse base attack speed, worse scaling... when those were all sorta the point of playing Tris:  her lategame.  Now Riot's tried to define some niche for her in tower destruction, but it's hard to figure out why you'd want to sacrifice everything else just to get it.
Then again... Jinx also does that well...
and other ADCs with AS boosts too.
They nerfed her passive, so that's why. Her identity is a tower-eater now.
Her AS early game makes me not want to play her as it becomes annoying to last hit at times,
Because her splash is ugly as fuck

She's trash tier now for many reasons that have already been covered elsewhere. The biggest problem is that she has the lowest damage of all ADCs. Riot's looking to help her out a little in 5.9 but it's nothing too significant. 

BTW: I consider Tristana's laning phase among the weakest in the game. However, unlike Kog or Twitch, the E passive makes farming under turret inconsistent. This delays her power spikes (which tbh aren't really any more meaningful than for other ADCs).

Lowest damage of all AD... Ashe, man. Currently, Ashe is the lowest damage of all ADCs, with exception to a solo Kalista maybe, and even then Kalista might still do more damage (but have no reliable CC that will actually bother a ranged champion in a duel). Tristana's damage isn't anything exemplary, but it isn't that low either.

Wait for her rework. She'll be one of the damage gods after that.

Her new passive is essentially a 10% total AD bonus damage effect for your auto-attacks.
Her new Q is a 40% AS steroid and potentially makes each of your autos use 1.35 times your AD as basis for damage calculations.

Um, "essentially a 10% total AD bonus for your autos"? 

We have a champion whose passive **actually does that**, and he's not considered OP. {{champion:42}}

With Ashe, it actually is a big difference.  First of all, she now has level 1 access to Furor passive (the one that makes crits grant AS) that lets her effectively have a free 15% AS all game long a second or two into a fight.  Pretty useful for an ADC who already has decent AS to start with.

Second, her passive 10% crit damage boost (as I am terming it) actually applies to her Q5 damage, making it a 1.1*1.35 multiplier during her Q5.   This is further amped by IE and PD (Hint, Shiv sucks very badly on new Ashe.  Her loss of crit damage in trade for crit consistency makes one of the strengths of Shiv, crit fishing to start a fight/poke, very weak).



Also, the Corki comparison is very different.  Corki is an AD caster, who focuses more on hard hitting spells comboed with trinity procs, than an AA focused machine gunner that AA AD carries are.  So yes, he gets 10% damage on his AAs(not applied to sheen/crits either)... that is only half of his damage output.   Meanwhile, Ashe gets 10% damage on her AAs... that is 90% of her damage output.  For comparison, Corki cares so little about his AAs he tends to grab Sorc Shoes over Bezerkers just to amp his spells that much more.

At least Ashe has the advantage of high range early on out, which keeps her relatively safe. Ashe will soon also have a passive slow, her own AS steroid that also couples as a DPS boost, conical long-range harass, a global sightbird and stun ult. Ashe trades off AD for safety and utility. Tristana trades out early game range and utility for what, tower-eating?
Deft gets first blood and still ends up 50 CS down at like the 15 minute mark.  Time to take a look at the Explosive Shot passive and her 1.x% Att.Sp. scaling.

Attack speed range and damage ( indirectly and directly).

She takes way to long to get to her point where she can carry, too cooldown dependant and still don't got that good range compared to jinx and kog'maw. Her only redeeming quality is her abillity to take down towers fast.
I've read the patchnotes and they tried to make her explosive shot better in lane. That may help since it's her early laning that's so bad that you can't really get ahead if the enemy plays properly.


I didn't really play jinx much before but I've decided to main her for a few weeks and see the results. So far i've can singlehandedly say she's the best adc in teamfights right now. Her abilllity to have like 2,1 as with 2 itrems is pretty retarded and she's got so much damage.
Never really did get why they turned the yordle with highest range at endgame into a midgame champ.

Wasn't old Tristana good in early game (because of high base damages) and then bad in the mid game and then strong in the late game because of her range and safety (W + R) and the damage she could put out with her Q steroid

I think Trist's biggest issue are her cast times. She's fairly mobile but stopping to e a target and stopping to w and stopping to r really makr things annoying. They're giving her some love in pbe but who knows what that'll do.

And she has to take way more risks early. And shes squishy. She's everythimg Jinx should be. I dunno why Jinx has such a solid early game and a monstrous late.

She lost her long range, which her combat ability had long been balanced around, and got very little in compensation. Increasing the duration of her rapid fire as you rank it up could help her lategame without making her razor edge laning oppressive.
Tristana sucks at all points of the game and Deft shouldn't have picked her. I don't care if she hyperscales or not. She just shouldn't sucks so much. She should be good at something.
If they'd let her AS not be so atrocious and give her back some of that range they took away, then she'd hyperscale just fine.

I would play Trist more again, but her early game farming recently got really awkward, and I struggle to CS at all for some reason.

I like Trists E and how it interacts with towers, and her ult being a CC and not an execute, I mean I don't know why we compare her to Jinx mechanically they aren't the same at all just have the roles and labels of being a hyper carry.

Not to say Trist isn't overshadowed by Jinx right now, I mean who isn't Jinx overshadowing at the moment? But Jinx isn't REAAALLY overpowered right now it just seems like all the other ADCs have been whipped around with nerfs and mini reworks and then left alone while Jinx has yet to get any changes. 

We could nerf her or buff the ones suffering.

It is also the fact that Jinx is that Jinx is okay or good in lane and is insanely strong in late game (AoE crit OP or permanent 110% AS isn't too bad either)  however she can be vulnerable since she has no escape and only has an unreliable and long cast time slow and a delayed root/snare
However all these tanks running around can usually protect her decently well at least
I already know her weaknesses which is why I said she wasn't overpowered. And I don't think she is the best ADC she just does the best at what most people want an ADC for.

Well for one, there's the fact that she excels at killing towers, so pro players focus on that. Even if she does have hyper carry potential, which I will argue she does, they aren't going to play towards that. Much like Irelia and Hecarim have pretty respectable late game if they get proper anti-carry items instead of Trinity -> Utility Tank.
She does have the problem that aside from their ults (and slightly wider AoE), she's a worse version of Jinx in team fights. Make no mistake, that Buster Shot can be game changing buuuuut it usually isn't. (And a well placed flame chomper sometimes does the same thing)
Because of the nature of rocket jump she's a fairly good assassin, it's a lot easier for her to get resets than with Jinx. I think because of her pick potential and her over-all scaling she still qualifies as a hyper carry.
